column2: Color PC drum motor malfunction • The color PC drum motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the color PC drum motor is being rotated.
• Color PC drum motor (M4) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between M4-PRCB CN12 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M4 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 M4 operation check PRCB CN12-3 to 6 13-E 4 Replace M4. 5 Replace PRCB.

Transport motor malfunction • The transport motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the transport motor is being rotated.
• Transport motor (M2) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between M2-PRCB CN11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M2 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 M2 operation check PRCB CN11-10 to 13 13-B to C 4 Replace M2. 5 Replace PRCB.

Developing motor malfunction • The developing motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the developing motor is being rotated.
• Developing motor (M1) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between M1-PRCB CN11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M1 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 M1 operation check PRCB CN11-3 to 6 13-B to C 4 Replace M1. 5 Replace PRCB.

Cooling fan motor malfunction • The cooling fan motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the cooling fan motor is being rotated.
• Cooling fan motor (FM11) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between FM11-relay CN29- PRCB CN10 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM11 operation check PRCB CN10-5 (REM) PRCB CN10-7 (LOCK) 5-E 4 Replace FM11. 5 Replace PRCB.

Power supply cooling fan malfunction • The power supply cooling fan does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time while it is being started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the power supply cooling fan is being rotated.
• Power supply cooling fan (FM10) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between FM10-relay CN43- PRCB CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the fan for possible overload and correct as necessary. 3 FM10 operation check PRCB CN2-1 (REM) 12-L PRCB CN2-3 (LOCK) 4 Replace FM10. 5 Replace PRCB.

2nd transfer pressure / retraction failure • The IDC sensor does not come into the condition where the level detection is available (retracted position = IDC sensor shutter is open) within a given period of time after the 2nd transfer pressure solenoid has turned ON. • The IDC sensor does not come into the condition where the level detection is not available (pressed position = IDC sensor shutter is closed) within a given period of time after the 2nd transfer pressure solenoid has turned ON.
• IDC sensor (IDCS) • Transport motor (M2) • 2nd transfer pressure solenoid (SD2) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between M2-PRCB CN11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M2 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between IDCS-PRCB CN19 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the connector between SD2-relay CN23-PRCB CN24 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 IDCS sensor check PRCB CN19-1 (IDC_D_LEFT) PRCB CN19-4 (IDC_CTL_LEFT) 13-K 6 SD2 operation check PRCB CN24-6 (REM) 5-D 7 M2 operation check PRCB CN11-10 to 13 13-B to C 8 Replace SD2. 9 Replace M2. 10 Replace IDCS. 11 Replace PRCB.

1st transfer pressure / retraction failure • The 1st transfer pressure sensor is not activated (retracted position) within a given period of time after the 1st transfer pressure solenoid has turned ON. • The 1st transfer pressure sensor is not deactivated (pressed position) within a given period of time after the 1st transfer pressure solenoid has turned ON.
• 1st transfer pressure sensor (PS17) • Transport motor (M2) • 1st transfer pressure solenoid (SD1) • Printer control board (PRCB)

1 Check the connector between M2-PRCB CN11 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the M2 connector for proper drive coupling and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between PS17-PRCB CN9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the connector between SD1-relay CN25-PRCB CN7 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 PS17 sensor check PRCB CN9-6 (ON) 12-J 6 SD1 operation check PRCB CN7-4 (REM) 13-D 7 M2 operation check PRCB CN11-10 to 13 13-B to C 8 Replace PS17. 9 Replace SD1. 10 Replace M2. 11 Replace PRCB.
Power malfunction When opening or closing the door and cover, a paper jam occurs, or the power is not supplied to the printer control board even after a specified period of time passed.
• Front door sensor (PS10) • Right door sensor (PS11) • Front door switch (SW2) • Right door switch (SW3) • DC power supply (DCPU) • Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB) • PH unit

1 Check the connector between PS10-PRCB CN15 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the connector between PS11-PRCB CN15 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between PRCB CN5-MFPB CN16 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Check the connector between DCPU CN4-relay CN90- SW2-SW3-relay CN90-PRCB CN1 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 5 Check the connector between DCPU CN3-PRCB CN3 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 6 Check the connector between PRCB CN18-relay CN63-PH unit for proper connection and correct as necessary. 7 PS10 sensor check PRCB CN15-3 (ON) 15-H 8 PS11 sensor check PRCB CN15-6 (ON) 15-H 9 Replace PRCB. 10 Replace DCPU. 11 Replace the PH unit. 12 Replace MFPB.

Polygon motor malfunction • The polygon motor does not rotate evenly even after the lapse of a given period of time after it has been started. • The motor lock signal remains HIGH for a given period of consecutive time while the polygon motor is being rotated.
• PH unit • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connector between PH unit-relay CN63- PRCB CN18 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the PH unit. 3 Replace PRCB.
Laser malfunction The SOS signal is not detected within a given period of time after the output of the laser has been started.
• PH unit • Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between PH unit-relay CN63- PRCB CN18 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check the connector between PH unit-MFPB CN15 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the PH unit. 4 Replace PRCB.

PH board communication error • Mismatching of data being written and read occurs continuously for certain times during communication with the PH board. • The EEPROM of the PH board is not yet initialized.
• Front door sensor (PS10) • Right door sensor (PS11) • Front door switch (SW2) • Right door switch (SW3) • DC power supply (DCPU) • Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB) • PH unit
1 Check the connector between PRCB CN18-relay CN63-PH unit for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the PH unit. 3 Replace PRCB.

Heating roller warm-up failure The thermistor/1 does not detect the specified temperature and the warm-up cycle is not completed even after the lapse of a given period of time after the cycle has been started.
• Fusing unit • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fusing unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fusing unit-PRCB CN9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fusing unit-DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Replace the fusing unit. 5 Replace PRCB. 6 Replace DCPU.

Thermistor open-circuit failure The temperature detected by the thermistor/1 or thermistor/2 does not reach a predetermined level even after the lapse of a given period time after the warm-up cycle has been started.
• Fusing unit • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fusing unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fusing unit-PRCB CN9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fusing unit-DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Replace the fusing unit. 5 Replace PRCB. 6 Replace DCPU.
Thermistor resistance failure The difference between the temperature detected by thermistor/1 and that detected by thermistor/2 exceeds a predetermined value.
• Fusing unit • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fusing unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fusing unit-PRCB CN9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fusing unit-DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Replace the fusing unit. 5 Replace PRCB. 6 Replace DCPU.
Abnormally low heating roller temperature The temperature detected by the thermistor/1 or thermistor/2 remains lower than the specified value.
• Fusing unit • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fusing unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fusing unit-PRCB CN9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fusing unit-DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Replace the fusing unit. 5 Replace PRCB. 6 Replace DCPU.
Abnormally high heating roller temperature The temperature detected by the thermistor/1 or thermistor/2 remains higher than the specified value.
• Fusing unit • Printer control board (PRCB) • DC power supply (DCPU)

1 Check the fusing unit for correct installation (whether it is secured in position). 2 Check the connector between fusing unit-PRCB CN9 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Check the connector between fusing unit-DCPU CN2 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 4 Replace the fusing unit. 5 Replace PRCB. 6 Replace DCPU.
Toner level sensor/Y malfunction An error occurs on the toner level sensor/Y.
• Toner level sensor/Y (PS13) • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connector between each sensor-PRCB CN21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Replace PRCB.
Toner level sensor/M malfunction An error occurs on the toner level sensor/M.
• Toner level sensor/M (PS14) • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connector between each sensor-PRCB CN21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Replace PRCB.
Toner level sensor/C malfunction An error occurs on the toner level sensor/C.
• Toner level sensor/C (PS15) • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connector between each sensor-PRCB CN21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Replace PRCB.
Toner level sensor/K malfunction An error occurs on the toner level sensor/K.
• Toner level sensor/K (PS16) • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connector between each sensor-PRCB CN21 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Replace the toner level sensor of the corresponding color. 3 Replace PRCB.
Imaging unit/C new article release. The status with the new unit is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new imaging unit is set.
• Imaging unit/C • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the imaging unit. 2 Check the connector between imaging unit-PRCB CN221 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the imaging unit. 4 Replace PRCB.
Imaging unit/M new article release. The status with the new unit is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new imaging unit is set.
• Imaging unit/M • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the imaging unit. 2 Check the connector between imaging unit-PRCB CN221 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the imaging unit. 4 Replace PRCB.
Imaging unit/Y new article release. The status with the new unit is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new imaging unit is set.
• Imaging unit/Y • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the imaging unit. 2 Check the connector between imaging unit-PRCB CN221 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the imaging unit. 4 Replace PRCB.
Imaging unit/K new article release. The status with the new unit is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new imaging unit is set.
• Imaging unit/K • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the imaging unit. 2 Check the connector between imaging unit-PRCB CN221 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the imaging unit. 4 Replace PRCB.
13CB
Toner cartridge/C new release failure. The status with the new cartridge is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new toner cartridge is set.
• Toner cartridge/C • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the toner cartridge. 2 Check the connector between toner cartridge-PRCB CN82 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the toner cartridge. 4 Replace PRCB.
13CC
Toner cartridge/M new release failure. The status with the new cartridge is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new toner cartridge is set.
• Toner cartridge/M • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the toner cartridge. 2 Check the connector between toner cartridge-PRCB CN82 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the toner cartridge. 4 Replace PRCB.
13CD
Toner cartridge/Y new release failure. The status with the new cartridge is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new toner cartridge is set.
• Toner cartridge/Y • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the toner cartridge. 2 Check the connector between toner cartridge-PRCB CN82 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the toner cartridge. 4 Replace PRCB.
13CE
Toner cartridge/K new release failure. The status with the new cartridge is not cleared continuously for 3 times after the new toner cartridge is set.
• Toner cartridge/K • Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Reinstall the toner cartridge. 2 Check the connector between toner cartridge-PRCB CN82 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace the toner cartridge. 4 Replace PRCB.
13DD
Backup data error. The engine counter data and the controller counter data are inconsistent.
• Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Select [SERVICE MODE] -> [BK CLEAR], and execute the BK Clear function. 2 Check the connector between MFPB CN16-PRCB CN5 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Replace PRCB. 4 Replace MFPB.
Engine flash ROM device fault. An erase error occurs during erasing of data in flash ROM.
• Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB)
1 Rewrite the engine firmware. 2 Replace PRCB.
Engine flash ROM download communication error. Flash ROM writing is found faulty during a check.
• Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB)
1 Rewrite the engine firmware. 2 Replace PRCB.
Engine control failure An undefined malfunction occurs in the engine section (PRCB, etc.).
• Printer control board (PRCB) • MFP board (MFPB)
1 Reboot the main body.
EEPROM fault 1 (main body) An EEPROM communication error of the main body occurs.
Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connectors on the PRCB for proper connection and correct any faulty connection as necessary. 2 Replace PRCB.
EEPROM fault 2 (main body) The engine serial number cannot be recovered.
Printer control board (PRCB)
1 Check the connectors on the PRCB for proper connection and correct any faulty connection as necessary. 2 Replace PRCB.

Lamp lights on and AFE gain adjustment failure. During the AFE gain adjustment, the error occurs continuously for three times after retrying in a state that the the peek value of the output data is 64 or less.
• Scanner unit • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between scanner unit-MFPB CN102 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check for possible extraneous light and correct as necessary. 3 Clean the lens, mirrors, AFE surface, and shading sheet if dirty. 4 Correct reflective mirror of the scanner if faulty, or change scanner mirror. 5 Replace the scanner unit. 6 Replace MFPB.
AFE offset adjustment error. During the offset adjustment, the offset value does not fall within the predetermined range a total of three times including retries.
• Scanner unit • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between scanner unit-MFPB CN102 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check for possible extraneous light and correct as necessary. 3 Clean the lens, mirrors, AFE surface, and shading sheet if dirty. 4 Correct reflective mirror of the scanner if faulty, or change scanner mirror. 5 Replace the scanner unit. 6 Replace MFPB.
AFE register setting error There is a mismatch between the set default values of the AFE gain/offset and the gain/offset values read thereafter.
• Scanner unit • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between scanner unit-MFPB CN102 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check for possible extraneous light and correct as necessary. 3 Clean the lens, mirrors, AFE surface, and shading sheet if dirty. 4 Correct reflective mirror of the scanner if faulty, or change scanner mirror. 5 Replace the scanner unit. 6 Replace MFPB.
White reference plate search error The black/white edge on the shading plate cannot be detected during initialization.
• Scanner unit • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between scanner unit-MFPB CN102 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check for possible extraneous light and correct as necessary. 3 Clean the lens, mirrors, AFE surface, and shading sheet if dirty. 4 Correct reflective mirror of the scanner if faulty, or change scanner mirror. 5 Replace the scanner unit. 6 Replace MFPB.
Scanner communication error A communication error of some sort occurs between the controller and the scanner.
• Scanner unit • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between scanner unit-MFPB CN102 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check for possible extraneous light and correct as necessary. 3 Clean the lens, mirrors, AFE surface, and shading sheet if dirty. 4 Correct reflective mirror of the scanner if faulty, or change scanner mirror. 5 Replace the scanner unit. 6 Replace MFPB.
Exposure lamp lighting failure detected. The intensity of the lamp is not stabilized within a predetermined period of time during the lamp stabilization check process in a lamp warm-up cycle.
• Scanner unit • MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the connector between scanner unit-MFPB CN102 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Check for possible extraneous light and correct as necessary. 3 Clean the lens, mirrors, AEF surface, and shading sheet if dirty. 4 Correct reflective mirror of the scanner if faulty, or change scanner mirror. 5 Replace the scanner unit. 6 Replace MFPB.
ROM contents error upon startup (MSC) A fault is detected in a sequence of ROM contents check of the MFPB during starting.
MFP board (MFPB)
1 Check the ROM version. 2 Rewrite the firmware. 3 Replace MFPB.
Firmware update error A firmware updating sequence is not normally terminated.
MFP board (MFPB)

1 Check the cable used for updating the firmware for proper connection and correct any faulty connection as necessary. 2 Check the firmware updating file; if the file is not correct, update the firmware again. 3 Check the firmware updating procedure; if the procedure is not correct, update the firmware again. 4 Update the firmware again. 5 Check the MFPB connector for proper connection and correct any faulty connection as necessary. 6 Replace MFPB.
Hard disk access error (connection failure) Unable to communicate between the hard disk and MFP board (MFPB).
• MFP board (MFPB) • HDD (HDD)
1 Check the connector between hard disk-MFPB CN5, CN13 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 2 Reinstall the hard disk. 3 Replace the hard disk. 4 Replace MFPB.
Hard disk full error The area made available as a user area is full during access to the hard disk.
• MFP board (MFPB) • HDD (HDD)

1 Set [Admin Settings] -> [Printer Settings] -> [HOLD JOB TIMEOUT] to [Disable]. 2 Check the connector between hard disk-MFPB CN5, CN13 for proper connection and correct as necessary. 3 Format the hard disk. 4 Replace the hard disk. 5 Replace MFPB.
No hard disk (found during a disk check) The hard disk is not mounted.
HDD
1 Install and format the hard disk.
Wrong hard disk (found during a disk check) • A hard disk intended for another model is mounted. • The hard disk capacity is short.
HDD
1 Replace the hard disk. 2 Format hard disk.
Hard disk check disk error When the power switch ON, the hard disk fails to be checked.
HDD
1 Replace the hard disk. 2 Format the hard disk.
Hard disk recovered (requiring reboot) When the power switch ON, the hard disk fails to be recovered.
HDD
1 Turn OFF/ON the power switch. 2 Replace the hard disk. 3 Format the hard disk.
Hard disk access fault When the power switch ON, the hard disk fails to be access.
HDD
1 Replace the hard disk. 2 Format the hard disk.
D0A2
No SSD board (found during a disk check) The SSD board is not mounted.
SSD board (SSDB)
1 Install the SSDB. 2 Using [Admin Settings] -> [Security Settings] -> [SSD Settings] -> [SSD Format], format the SSD.
D0A3
Wrong SSD board (found during a disk check) • A SSD board intended for another model is mounted. • The SSD board capacity is short.
SSD board (SSDB)
1 Replace SSDB. 2 Using [Admin Settings] -> [Security Settings] -> [SSD Settings] -> [SSD Format], format the SSD.
D0A4
SSD board check disk error When the power switch ON, the SSD board fails to be checked.
SSD board (SSDB)

1 Using [Admin Settings] -> [Security Settings] -> [SSD Settings] -> [SSD Format], format the SSD. 2 Replace SSDB. 3 Using [Admin Settings] -> [Security Settings] -> [SSD Settings] -> [SSD Format], format the SSD.
D0A5
SSD board recovered (requiring reboot) When the power switch ON, the SSD board fails to be recovered.
SSD board (SSDB)
1 Turn OFF/ON the power switch. 2 Replace SSDB. 3 Using [Admin Settings] -> [Security Settings] -> [SSD Settings] -> [SSD Format], format the SSD.
D0A6
SSD board access fault When the power switch ON, the SSD board fails to be access.
SSD board (SSDB)
1 Replace SSDB. 2 Using [Admin Settings] -> [Security Settings] -> [SSD Settings] -> [SSD Format], format the SSD.
D3A2
Counter error A write error occurs in the counter area.
MFP board (MFPB)
1 Check the MFPB for its mounting condition and correct any faulty condition. 2 Replace MFPB 3 If the same trouble code persists after the abovementioned procedures, the EEPROM is probably damaged.
D3F1
Successful completion of counter backup The counter backup process is completed successfully.
1 This code is displayed when the counter backup process is completed successfully. When this code is displayed, turn OFF/ON the power switch and then perform the given steps. G.3.10 MFP board (MFPB)
D3F2
Write error of the counter area (NVRAM) An error occurs in the counter area when writing to the BootFlash.
MFP board (MFPB)
1 Turn OFF/ON the power switch. 2 Check the MFPB for its mounting condition and correct any faulty condition. 3 Replace MFPB
D3F3
Write error of the counter area (SSD) An error occurs in the counter area when writing to the EEPROM.
MFP board (MFPB)

1 Turn OFF/ON the power switch. 2 Check the MFPB for its mounting condition and correct any faulty condition. 3 Replace MFPB 4 If the same trouble code persists after the abovementioned procedures, replace the EEPROM with the one has been installed on the new board.
D3F4
Copy write error of the counter area An error occurs in the counter area when restoring from the EEPROM to the BootFlash.
MFP board (MFPB)

1 Turn OFF/ON the power switch. 2 Check the MFPB for its mounting condition and correct any faulty condition. 3 Replace MFPB 4 If the same trouble code persists after the abovementioned procedures, replace the EEPROM with the one has been installed on the new board.
FLASH error The SSD board (SSDB) develops a fault.
• MFP board (MFPB) • SSD board (SSDB)
1 Check the SSD for its mounting condition and correct any faulty condition. 2 Replace MFPB.
FB00 ... FBA5
Abort code
MFP board (MFPB)

1 Power switch Turn OFF and ON the power switch, and check if the Abort code appears again. NO When not reappearing, continuous use is carried out, and it is checked whether an abort code occurs. 2 Connector connection Check the connector for proper connection on MFPB and correct as necessary. NO It will correct, if connector connection has abnormalities. 3 Firmware Update the firmware to the latest version, and check if the Abort code appears again. NO After conducting firmware updating, check the firmware version No. and confirm that the firmware has been normally updated. 4 MFP board Replace MFPB
